result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd C. Froemel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

parties.name: Sawyer County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: 1 year probation, conditions of probation: 50 days in the county jail with credit for 52 days served.  Restitution of $200 plus surcharges to be paid to Candace Blietz J&S.  Pay court costs $453.00.  NO CONTACT with Care Partners Assisted Living.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. DEF must maintain full time employment.

miscConds.notes: $200 plus surcharges. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd C. Froemel in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Todd C. Froemel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:38 Am  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State argues sentencing -  9 months county jail 192 days credit, defendant still has a pending drug charge.  Atty Moldenhauer makes arguement requests credit for time served.  Court questions the State as to prior convictions.  Atty Moldenhauer makes stmt.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant addressed the Court.

Court:  Sentence - 7 months county jail with credit for 192 days time served

records.addlTxt: of right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Todd C. Froemel in court, in custody, with attorney James J Rennicke.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  State moves to amend Ct #1 to Criminal Tresspass 943.14, Misd A, Ct#2 to be dismissed but read in.  Court so approves.  DEF pleads No Contest to the amended charge, found Guilty and convicted of Ct. #1.  Ct #2 dismissed and read in.  Sentence is withheld and DEF is placed on 1 year probation, conditions of probation: 50 days in the county jail with credit for 52 days served.  Restitution of $200 plus surcharges to be paid to Candace Blietz.  Pay court costs $453.00.  NO CONTACT with Care Partners Assisted Living.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. DEF must maintain full time employment.

Defendant Todd C. Froemel in court with attorney James J Rennicke.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Arraignment scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
No contact wityh Care Partners Assisted Living, their business, parking lot, and employees.  Curfew between the hours of 7PM - 6AM
Condition of no contact with Care Partners, their business, parking, employees, curfew between hours of 7PM-6AM and all other conditions, if any, remain the same from former bond.
Condition of no contact with Care Partners, their business, parking, employees, curfew between hours of 7PM-6AM and all other conditions, if any, remain the same from former bond.

Defendant Todd C. Froemel in court via video means with attorney James J Rennicke.  Defendant Todd C. Froemel in custody.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  D's atty requested to be heard on bond.  State has no objections.  D's attorney requested to convert bond to signature bond.  State objects in order to protect the public out of necessity.  State likes proposed curfew inclusion on bond from the hours of 7PM-6AM, unless employed.  Court modified bond to $1,000 cash bond, with no contact with Care Partners, their business, their parking lot, their employees, added curfew 7PM-6AM and other conditions, if any, remain same from former bond.  Preliminary requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

DEF appears by video in custody.  ADA John Yackel appears for the state.  $2000 cash bond ordered with condition of No Contact with Care Partners Assisted Living.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 3rd at 8:30 am.
No contact with Care Partners Assisted Living
